Comment 1: 
It's true that the current spec defines some constructs as initialization loops that
could be implemented without any actual loop.  However, the current spec is reasonably
easy to understand and reasonably easy to implement
(http://golang.org/ref/spec#Package_initialization).  For cases that can work even
though the language spec does not permit them, you can write an init function.  This is
an area where simplicity and ease of understanding seems more important than trying to
permit every possible case.
